com.vmware.helper

Class VimUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vmware.helper.VimUtil

  • public class VimUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    VMware utility class developed for performing the following operations on a vCenterServer / Esxi host
    1. Fetch basic information and properties of managed objects
    2. Invoke basic operations on managed objects
    Date Created: 01/16/2014

    VimUtil could be invoked from the command line with the following parameters and operations
    -url <'url to vCenter Server or Esxi host'>
    -u <'username'>
    -p <'password'>
    [Available Operations]

    -importVM <'hostname'> <'path to ovf file'> [new vm name]
    -exportVM <'vmname'> <'localpath to ovf file'>
    -powerOnVM <'vmname'>
    -powerOffVM <'vmname'>
    -createVM
    -deleteVM <'vmname'>
    -listVMs [hostname]
    -listHosts
    -listResourcePools
    -listRP-VMs
    -listHost-VMs
    -installVMTools <'vmname'>
    -vminfo <'vmname'> <'vmproperty'>

      • getVMListFromHost

        public java.util.List<?> getVMListFromHost(java.lang.String hostName,
                                  boolean retName)
        Method for getting list of all VMs on a given hostname
        Parameters:
        hostName - name of the host system
        retName - set it to true if list of all VM names are to be returned. set to false to return list of all VM MORs
        Returns:
        list of MORs or names of all matched VMs depending on retName parameter

        Method to get a map of ResourcePool to VM mapping
        Returns:
        a map whose key is the ResourcePool name and value is a Vector<'String'> of vmnames belonging to the respective ResourcePool

        Method to retrieve all or specific properties of a given entity
        Parameters:
        entityType - type of the managed entity
        entityName - name of the managed entity
        props - specific list of properties to be retrieved. If passed null, the method will retrieve all properties
        Returns:
        map containing property name as the key and the property's value as the value

        public boolean powerOnVM(java.lang.String vmName,
                java.lang.String hostName)
        Method to power ON a given VM name on a specific host name.
        Parameters:
        vmName - name of the virtual machine that needs to be powered on
        hostName - name of the host where the requested vmName resides. This parameter is optional.
        Returns:
        true if the operation is successful, false otherwise
